attributes.action: winter fuel payments for expats in centre of france
attributes.additional_details: I live in the centre of France...it reaches -10 to -20 degrees in winter, from December to March, with 20 to 40 mph winds, which brings the temperatures to Canada level, which I do  not think is a WARM country.  We are pensioners, and not all of us have central heating, which I believe many people who live on benefits in the UK have.  Please remember us!
